executable.title: Tensor Estimation
executable.description: This step will convert a b-value averaged diffusion tensor image to a 3x3 tensor voxel image. This step takes the diffusion tensor image data and generates a tensor representation of the data based on the signal intensity decay, b values applied, and the diffusion difrections. The apparent diffusion coefficient for a given orientation is computed on a pixel-by-pixel basis by fitting the image data (voxel intensities) to the Stejskal-Tanner equation. If at least 6 diffusion directions are used, then the diffusion tensor can be computed. This program uses itk::DiffusionTensor3DReconstructionImageFilter. The user can adjust background threshold, median filter, and isotropic resampling.

parameters.label: Input Image Files
parameters.description: Parameters for specifying the averaged Bvalue diffusion tensor image set

image.name: inputVolume
image.description: Required: input image 4D NRRD image. Must contain data based on at least 6 distinct diffusion directions. The inputVolume is allowed to have multiple b0 and gradient direction images. Averaging of the b0 image is done internally in this step. Prior averaging of the DWIs is not required.
image.label: Input Image Volume

parameters.label: Output Image Files
parameters.description: Output file from conversion from Dicom to NRRD

image.name: outputVolume
image.description: Required: name of output NRRD file containing the Tensor vector image
image.label: Output Tensor Image Volume

parameters.label: Tensor Conversion Parameters
parameters.description: Input parameters controlling the mapping from averaged B values to 3 by 3 tensors

integer-vector.name: medianFilterSize
integer-vector.description: Median filter radius in all 3 directions
integer-vector.label: Median Filter Size

string-enumeration.name: maskProcessingMode
string-enumeration.description: ROIAUTO: mask is implicitly defined using a otsu forground and hole filling algorithm. ROI: Uses the masks to define what parts of the image should be used for computing the transform. NOMASK: no mask used
string-enumeration.label: Mask Processing Mode

image.name: maskVolume
image.description: Mask Image, if maskProcessingMode is ROI
image.label: Mask Image Volume

integer.name: backgroundSuppressingThreshold
integer.description: Image threshold to suppress background. This sets a threshold used on the b0 image to remove background voxels from processing. Typically, values of 100 and 500 work well for Siemens and GE DTI data, respectively. Check your data particularly in the globus pallidus to make sure the brain tissue is not being eliminated with this threshold.
integer.label: B0 Image Threshold

boolean.name: resampleIsotropic
boolean.description: Flag to resample to isotropic voxels. Enabling this feature is recommended if fiber tracking will be performed.
boolean.label: Resample To Isotropic Voxels

float.name: voxelSize
float.description: Isotropic voxel size to resample to
float.label: Isotropic Voxel Size

integer.name: b0Index
integer.description: Index in input vector index to extract
integer.label: Vector Image B0 Index

boolean.name: applyMeasurementFrame
boolean.description: Flag to apply the measurement frame to the gradient directions
boolean.label: Apply Measurement Frame

integer-vector.name: ignoreIndex
integer-vector.description: Ignore diffusion gradient index. Used to remove specific gradient directions with artifacts.
integer-vector.label: Ignore Indices

integer.name: numberOfThreads
integer.label: Number Of Threads
integer.description: Explicitly specify the maximum number of threads to use.
